channel.title: chickpeas on Yummy Collection
channel.description: Recent content in chickpeas on Yummy Collection

item.title: Indian Pumpkin Chickpea Curry
item.description: Ingredients 1 small onion, finely diced 800g red kuri squash, in small dices 2 carrots, small discs 400g chickpeas (not dried) 1 clove garlic 1 ts ginger, finely chopped 1 Tbsp curry powder 1 pinch of chili powder 1 can coconut milk 500ml vegetable stock 100g red lentils salt coriander Optional: 4 Tbsp mango chutney Instructions Add the ingredients in the above order (the liquids should now just cover the ingredients) Simmer for about 3-4 hours on the highest level or until the pumpkin pieces are quite soft Now add the dried lentils and continue to simmer for about 2 hours on LOW The dish is ready when the pumpkin is soft as butter and everything has a creamy consistency

item.title: Stuffed Sweetpotatoe
item.description: Ingredients 3 Tbsp of olive oil 1 onion 4 cloves of garlic 1 Tbsp of ginger 15g dried tomatoes 1 lemon 1 ts of chilli flakes 200g chickpeas (already cooked) 200g fresh baby spinach 210ml coconut milk 1 ts of salt 2 sweet potatoes Instructions Preheat the oven to 175°C Rub sweet potatoes with 2 Tbsp of olive oil and loosely wrap each one in a piece of aluminum foil.

item.title: Sweetpotatoe Soup
item.description: Ingredients One onion, chopped to small pieces Two garlic cloves, chopped 700g sweetpotatoe, chopped into 1cm chunks 3-4 carrots, chopped into small discs 1 can chickpeas around 1.3l broth 1-2 Tbsp lemon juice Fresh coriander Optional: 1 chili pepper Spices (White) pepper Coriander Cumin Instructions Add everything except coriander and lemon juice to the crockpot Cook for 4 hours on high (or 8h on low), blend everything to a fine soup Add the lemon juice Serve with chopped coriander
